oai_dc:dc.dc:title: In-situ phase transformation studies of Ni48Mn39In13 melt-spun ribbons
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KUMAR, DMR
RAO, DVS

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Magnetic intermetallics
Rapid solidification processing
Microstructure

transmission
SHAPE-MEMORY ALLOYS
MARTENSITIC TRANSFORMATIONS
HEUSLER ALLOYS
GA ALLOYS
TEMPERATURES
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The phase transformation in Ni48Mn39In13 melt-spun ribbons has been studied by employing in-situ transmission electron microscopy (TEM) techniques. At room temperature, the investigations showed the martensite phase consisting of plates with internal stacking faults. This phase exhibited the presence of 7M and 5M modulations. In addition, a small volume fraction of the austenite phase was observed. Upon in-situ heating from room temperature to 95 degrees C, the martensite phase transformed to austenite phase. However, in the subsequent cooling-heating cycles, the martensite phase was retained at high temperature. We discuss our experimental observations and the possible mechanisms for the stabilization of the martensite phase due to thermal cycling. (c) 2012 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
